channel.title: Dear Esther no longer a free mod; commercial release
channel.description:
Dead Esther is now going to be on steam as re-developed by Robert Briscoe and the original creator, Dan Pinchbeck. [quote] thechineseroom have announced that the remake of the critically acclaimed, award-winning mod Dear Esther will be getting a full commercial release in summer 2011. [/quote]
[quote] The groundbreaking game, which replaces traditional FPS gameplay with the exploration of a desolate island, a deep and emotional story and a stunning soundtrack, will be launched on Steam later this year. Over the last twelve months, the award-winning mod (Indiecade 2009, Mod of the Year 2010) has been re-developed by Robert Briscoe (Mirror's Edge) in collaboration with the original creator, Dan Pinchbeck. [/quote] [url='https://www.moddb.com/mods/dear-esther/news/dear-esther-remake-to-get-commercial-release']https://www.moddb.com/mods/dear-esther/news/dear-esther-remake-to-get-commercial-release[/url]
What does BM community think of this?

item.title: Dear Esther no longer a free mod; commercial release
item.dc:creator: Scorch6679
item.description:
Well it looks nice though I probably wouldn’t buy it for that. I wouldn’t even be able to buy it if I wanted to. So I’ll just shrug and forget about it and hope black mesa will be free.
I can’t play many new games that are coming out now because I still have a shitty single core so finding something fun and new that I can actually play is rare.

Next thing I know Black mesa decides to upgrade to portal 2’s source build and blow up on graphics.
Kind of ranted there, sorry.

Read full topic

item.source: Dear Esther no longer a free mod; commercial release

item.title: Dear Esther no longer a free mod; commercial release
item.dc:creator: Shinobi
item.description:
garthbartin:

@slowpokes Bro you have no way of knowing that the story will be more jumbled up. My guess is the story will be much clearer. If he’s making everything better it’d stand to reason that he’ll make the story easier to understand. I might buy it if it’s pretty cheap. Just because it is so visually stunning. It’d be really cool if someone made a L4D2 campaign out of it, but now that it is going commercial I doubt that’ll be possible.

I heard about this game a little before it came out but hadn’t played it till now. I was intrigued with the idea so I did a little research on the game. It was a research project at a college to see what would happen if a game was stripped of all action and only had the narrative left over. It was also supposed to be ambiguous as to the story. Depending on how one interprets the story, each person can have completely different ideas of who you are, who Esther is, what the island stands for, heck if you are even alive or not. I doubt the story will change much, actually I think the voice overs might be the one thing they are porting directly from the original game. I for one am looking forward to it. While I found the mod very slow, for some reason I want to replay it again. It was unlike any experience I have ever had in a video game.

Read full topic
